## AbstractDevice.readPixels() method

Read pixel values from current frame buffer

**Signature:**

```typescript
readPixels(index: number, x: number, y: number, w: number, h: number, buffer: TypedArray): Promise<void>;
```

</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description

</td><td>

</td><td>

color attachment index


</td></tr>

</td><td>

number


</td><td>

</td></tr>

</td><td>

number


</td><td>

</td><td>

</td></tr>

</td><td>

The output buffer


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

Promise&lt;void&gt;

## Remarks

This method reads the data asynchronously to prevent GPU stall. For WebGL1 devices, the GPU stall is still inevitable.
